title: Why Bhakta Hanuman is so Famous? | Sri Sampati Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.key_quote: Hanuman used his power, his intelligence, his courage in the service of delivering dharmand nyaya.
segments.summary: This segment introduces Hanuman as an inspiring example of servant leadership, highlighting his power, intelligence, and courage in upholding dharma and nyaya.

segments.key_quote: Hanuman is popular and worshipped because throughout his life, he used his power, his intelligence, his courage in the service of Dharma, in the service of Nyaya, in the service of delivering Dharma and Nyaya.
segments.summary: This segment illustrates Hanuman's commitment to dharma and nyaya through examples like his support for Sugriv and his efforts to bring justice to Lord Shriram and Mother Sita.

segments.key_quote: Anybody who takes the side of adharma and anyai, they will be dead and they will be forgotten.
segments.summary: This segment contrasts Hanuman's enduring popularity with the forgotten fates of Ravana's servants and other historical figures who sided with adharma, emphasizing the importance of serving a glorious leader and upholding dharma.

segments.key_quote: Hanuman received nothing in return. He received the love of Shri Ram.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes Hanuman's selfless service and the love he received from Lord Shriram as his reward, highlighting his example as a servant leader who inspires others to follow dharma and nyaya without expecting personal gain.
